mainBoard.name: Bad Moon
mainBoard.originalText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

mainBoard.flavorText: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.
mainBoard.name: Black Knight
mainBoard.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

foreignData.flavorText: Die Knochen um uns herum fügten sich zu missgestalteten Skeletten zusammen, obwohl wir sie immer wieder zerschlugen.
foreignData.name: Heer der geplagten Skelette

mainBoard.name: Drudge Skeletons
mainBoard.text: {B}: Regenerate this creature. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, instead tap it, remove it from combat, and heal all damage on it.)

mainBoard.name: El-Hajjâj
mainBoard.originalText: You gain 1 life for every point of damage El-Hajjâj inflicts.
mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

foreignData.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann nur durch schwarze Kreaturen und Artefaktkreaturen geblockt werden.

mainBoard.name: Fear
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked by any creatures except black creatures and artifact creatures.

Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

mainBoard.originalText: {2}: Gives one creature flying ability until end of turn. If that creature is destroyed before end of turn, so is Flying Carpet.

mainBoard.flavorText: "There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade." —Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

mainBoard.text: {B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

foreignData.name: Heulen aus dem Jenseits
foreignData.text: Die Zielkreatur erhält +X/+0 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Howl from Beyond
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +X/+0 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: She walks in the twilight, her steps make no sound,/ Her feet leave no tracks on the dew-covered ground./ Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—/ But those who go with her are never the same.
mainBoard.name: Lost Soul
mainBoard.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."
—Keevy Bogsbury
mainBoard.name: Marsh Gas
mainBoard.originalText: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

foreignData.name: Nachtmahr
foreignData.text:
Kann fliegen.
Stärke und Widerstandskraft des Nachtmahrs entsprechen der Anzahl der Sümpfe, die der Beherrscher im Spiel hat.

mainBoard.name: Nightmare
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
mainBoard.name: Scathe Zombies
Spirit Shackle
mainBoard.originalText: Put a -0/-2 counter on target creature every time it becomes tapped. Counters remain even if enchantment is removed.

rulings.text: Spirit Shackle's ability triggers only when the enchanted creature changes from untapped to tapped. If Spirit Shackle enters attached to an already tapped creature, it won't do anything (until that creature untaps and becomes tapped again, that is).

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, put a -0/-2 counter on it.

foreignData.name: Terror
foreignData.text: Bringe eine Kreatur direkt auf den Friedhof. Dieser Zauber hat keine Wirkung auf schwarze und Artefaktkreaturen.

mainBoard.name: Terror
mainBoard.originalText: Buries target creature. Cannot target black creatures or artifact creatures.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

foreignData.name: Belebung der Toten
foreignData.text: Nimm eine Kreatur aus einem der Friedhöfe und bringe sie sofort auf Deiner Seite mit -1/-0 ins Spiel. Behandle diese Kreatur, als wäre sie gerade erst beschworen worden. Wenn die Verzauberung entfernt wird, begrabe sie auf dem Friedhof ihres Eigentümers.

sideBoard.name: Animate Dead
sideBoard.originalText: Any creature in any graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. At end of game, or if this enchantment is discarded without removing target creature from play, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

rulings.text: Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won't be returned to the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can't legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won't be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature's still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

sideBoard.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When this Aura enters, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with this Aura." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach this Aura to it. When this Aura leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

sideBoard.flavorText: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
sideBoard.name: Bog Wraith
sideBoard.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

sideBoard.name: Brass Man
sideBoard.originalText: Brass Man does not untap as normal; you must pay {1} during your untap phase to untap it.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

sideBoard.text:
This creature doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap this creature.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—*Song of the Artificer*
sideBoard.name: Obsianus Golem

foreignData.name: Simulakrum
foreignData.text: Alle Schadenspunkte, die Dir bislang in diesem Zug zugefügt worden sind, werden rückwirkend auf eine Deiner Kreaturen gelenkt. Falls Du in diesem Zug weiteren Schaden erleidest, wird dieser allerdings ganz normal behandelt.

sideBoard.name: Simulacrum
sideBoard.originalText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. Even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

rulings.text: This is not damage prevention or redirection. It actually is life gain and newly dealt damage.
You can't use Simulacrum on Loss of Life, just damage.
Simulacrum is the source of the damage. If an effect needs to know a characteristic of the damage's source, it will see the damage coming from Simulacrum.

sideBoard.text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.
